trans-unit.source: First release (“Hi daddy!”, as my soul would tag it)
trans-unit.target: First release (“Hi daddy!”, as my soul would tag it)

trans-unit.source: Fix collation name printer (PR #44), thanks to Ronan Dunklau
trans-unit.target: Fix collation name printer (PR #44), thanks to Ronan Dunklau

trans-unit.source: Fix corner issues surfaced implementing some more DDL statement printers

trans-unit.source: Fix cosmetic issue with ANY() and ALL()
trans-unit.target: Исправьте косметическую проблему с помощью ANY()и ALL().

trans-unit.source: Fix endless loop due to sloppy conversion of command line option
trans-unit.target: Исправление бесконечного цикла из-за неаккуратного преобразования опции командной строки

trans-unit.source: Fix function body dollar quoting (PR #39), thanks to Bennie Swart
trans-unit.target: Fix function body dollar quoting (PR #39), thanks to Bennie Swart

trans-unit.source: Fix inconsistent spacing in JOIN condition inside a nested expression

trans-unit.source: Fix indentation of boolean expressions in SELECT’s targets (issue #3)
trans-unit.target: Fix indentation of boolean expressions in SELECT’s targets (issue #3)

trans-unit.source: Fix issue in the safety belt check performed by

trans-unit.source: I needed a better SQL reformatter than the one implemented by sqlparse, and was annoyed by a few glitches (subselects in particular) that ruins the otherwise excellent job it does, considering that it is a generic library that tries to swallow many different SQL dialects.
trans-unit.target: I needed a better SQL reformatter than the one implemented by sqlparse, and was annoyed by a few glitches (subselects in particular) that ruins the otherwise excellent job it does, considering that it is a generic library that tries to swallow many different SQL dialects.

trans-unit.source: This is a Python 3 module that exposes the parse tree of a PostgreSQL statement (extracted by the almost standard PG parser repackaged as a standalone static library by libpg_query) as set of interconnected nodes, usually called an abstract syntax tree.
trans-unit.target: This is a Python 3 module that exposes the parse tree of a PostgreSQL statement (extracted by the almost standard PG parser repackaged as a standalone static library by libpg_query) as set of interconnected nodes, usually called an abstract syntax tree.

trans-unit.source: When I found psqlparse I decided to try implementing a PostgreSQL focused tool: at the beginning it’s been easier than I feared, but I quickly hit some shortcomings in that implementation, so I opted for writing my own solution restarting from scratch, with the following goals:
trans-unit.target: When I found psqlparse I decided to try implementing a PostgreSQL focused tool: at the beginning it’s been easier than I feared, but I quickly hit some shortcomings in that implementation, so I opted for writing my own solution restarting from scratch, with the following goals:

trans-unit.target: позволяют исследовать дерево разбора в обоих направлениях,так как я понял,что некоторые виды узлов требуют этих знаний для определения их текстового представления
